history.content: Assuming here you're L&S CS as you have a backup. Might be smart just to not take another course so you can focus more on 61b and the GPA cutoff. Also guessing you're a junior transfer though since you already took cs70. Every CS upperdiv requires 61b or 61c, and every EE or EECS one requires 16ab, so you can't really do anything in department. If you aren't worried about breadth and really don't wanna just try out a course for fun or anything, Math 53 (multivar calculus) is useful and/or required for a lot of upper div mathy EECS courses like 189. If you've already done that in community college, Math 110 would be a good class to take (assuming you've done linear algebra before). ML math revolves around two main hemispheres: the probability/stats stuff in 126 and the linear algebra/limited calculus optimization problems of 127. Really getting down linear algebra in Math 110 will both knock out a math degree requirement and really solidify you math wise in EECS

children.subject:
But if i take only EE16A and CS61B, what else can I take to meet the 13  units (if I decide not to take math). 

       Thanks a Lot!

history.content:
Hi , 

       I am currently taking cs70 and cs61A this semester and one American cultures . I am currently enrolled in EE16A and cs61B for spring . What else can I take ? Maybe a Math class for applied math in case I don't meet the cutoff. Any recommendation . My backup major is applied math.

                                                               Thank you!!
